pr_title: Feature/select resource from new search page

timeline.message: Ignore eslint checks for legacy JS code.

Refactor legacy code to support select resources
from new search UI. This includes:

1. Separate the functionality of updating course list
to a single function.

2. Improve function 'selectAllAttachmentsFunction'.
3. Some tweaks for 'CourseListSection'.
Change the type of parameters passed to 'selectAllAttachments'.
Export interface 'LegacyContentResponse'.

Fundamentals for selecting resources from new search UI. This includes:

1. A few type definitions for required data structure.
2. Two functions that build request URL and body data .
3. An abstract function sending request to server and firing callbacks.
4. A function updating the 'selection-summary' div in 'selectOrAdd'.
Integrate SearchResult with SelectionSessionModule.

Ensure new search page search options persist when
resources are unselected from the course list.
Tidy ups for SelectionSessionModule.

Create a server event handler for selecting attachments
from new search UI in 'selectOrAdd'.

The existing handler will unselect an attachment if the
attachment is selected, which is not needed in new search
UI. So implement a new handler which only adds an attachment.

Allow the Selection Summary panel to be updated by
an ajax request when new search UI is enabled.

To achieve this, the JS file for AJAX Effect must be
included in the context of new search UI.
Remove redundant field 'isAllAttachments' for 'SelectResourceProps'.

Use JS History API to navigate from Selection Checkout page
back to Search page.

The previous approach is to refresh the whole page which works
fine for Old UI. But with new search UI refreshing the page
will result in missing search options. Luckily, new search UI
can read search options stored in Browser history. Therefore,
using JS History API is probably the best way at this stage.
And it still works fine with Old UI.
Merge branch 'component/new-search-page-in-selection-section' into feature/select-resource-from-new-search-page

Update SelectionSessionModule and SearchResult

1. Remove redundant interface 'SelectResourceProps'.
2. Centralise the validation for Selection Session info
inb one function.
3. Update comments and clean up the code.
Merge branch 'component/new-search-page-in-selection-section' into feature/select-resource-from-new-search-page
Merge branch 'component/new-search-page-in-selection-section' into feature/select-resource-from-new-search-page

Do not convert query string params to search options
in Selection Session.
Clean up SelectionSessionModule.
Add a Jest test for selecting resources from new search UI.
Add more Jest tests in SelectionSessionModule.

Move the test for function 'isSelectionSessionOpen' to
its own describe block.

timeline.bodyText: I did not put this function in the REST Module as we don't have REST endpoints for Selection Session yet. In addition, I am unsure how to write tests for this function. I can make a mocked Axios.post though and check if the callback has been called or not.
timeline.author: PenghaiZhang

replies.bodyText: Yup, you're right not to put this in the REST module. But I feel we need to somehow highlight this is the interface to Legacy Selection Sessions. I wonder if we should push these interface definitions, HTTP calls and supporting functions into maybe something called LegacySelectionSessionModule.ts and maybe at the top of the file a file wide comment stating that this Module is all about interacting with the Legacy AJAX endpoints for selections sessions, and will be used until the supporting REST endpoints are developed. 🤔
replies.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: Good idea. I have renamed the module.

timeline.author: edalex-ian
edalex-ian

replies.bodyText:
I think we should use unknown  as this type is for the parameter passed to the callback, which is unknown in this case.
 updateCourseList: (data: unknown) => void;
replies.author: PenghaiZhang

timeline.bodyText: Was this pushed into a function to allow you to call from TS side?
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: Yes it's. It was part of updateTargetFolder
replies.author: PenghaiZhang

replies.bodyText: Yes, we use this function in SelectionSessionModule.ts
replies.author: PenghaiZhang

timeline.bodyText: This seems like a significant change and removal of an optimisation. Could you explain the backstory here please?
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText:
With previous code, if we want to remove some selected resources in the dialog, when we close the dialog, we will only see that the currently selected course gets its UI updated.
For example, course A has two resources and course B has one. And B is currently selected.
So in the course list we should see
A   (2)
B   (1)

And then we remove all selected resources and it's expected to see
A   (0)
B   (0)

But what is actually displayed is
A   (2)
B   (0)

A does not get updated. If we navigate to a different page which results in a page refresh, we will see the correct UI.
replies.author: PenghaiZhang

replies.bodyText: Okay, but... Does that mean this is effectively fixing a bug in the Legacy mode too? Or more so, that bug was just not exhibited due to a server side re-render?
replies.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText:
Yes it also fixes this bug for Legacy mode.  And yes again, this bug was hidden due to a server side re-render.
You can search versionDialog.setOkCallback in CourseListSection, and you will see the callback was a ReloadFunction which is used to reload the page I reckon.
replies.author: PenghaiZhang

timeline.bodyText: Sorry, I've lost track of the threads. Where is this triggered from?
timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText:
The only usage of this is in SelectionSessionModule.ts. There is an existing one named selectAttachment, and there are two key differences:

this one will not unselect an attachment if the button is clicked again.
this one supports selecting multiple attachments.
replies.author: PenghaiZhang

replies.bodyText: Ah! How it is triggered? Just but building up the correct events etc for the POST?
replies.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText:
Yes, but we must tell the server the correct section, which is ilad here.
ilad is probably the short name of AbstractItemlikeListAttachmentDisplaySection.
That is why I did
 event__: [`ilad.selectAttachmentsFromNewSearch`],

I am pretty sure I have seen how server processes this event__ and finds the matched method from the section. But I can't remember much detail now...
replies.author: PenghaiZhang

timeline.message: Rename SelectionSessionModule to LegacySelectionSessionModule
Tweaks for LegacySelectionSessionModule test.

Add one more Jest test for not showing selection
buttons in non-Selection Sessions.

Also improve readability of the test for showing and
clicking selection buttons.
Tidy ups for LegacySelectionSessionModule.
Fix the comment format issue in 'attachments.js'.

Centralise mocked 'renderData' and 'getRenderData'
into a helper file.

Add Jest tests for building the data sent to
Legacy Selection Session endpoints.

timeline.bodyText: That's odd. Are you aware this is sitting in the buildPostDataForStructured describe block?

replies.bodyText: oops I will move this describe out.
replies.author: PenghaiZhang

timeline.author: edalex-ian

replies.bodyText: But I guess fireEvent.click will complain because selectorControl could be null.
replies.author: PenghaiZhang

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, here is the error:
Argument of type 'HTMLElement | null' is not assignable to parameter of type 'Element | Node | Window | Document'.
Type 'null' is not assignable to type 'Element | Node | Window | Document'.
What about we use a if statement and throw an error if queryByLabelText returns null ? We have used this approach for querySelector in a few places.
replies.author: PenghaiZhang

replies.bodyText:
Yup, I'd say that'd be the plan. But just wrap the fireEvent in the if.
Actually, this is probably a valid case of using the not null (!) postfix operator - as we definitely know (due to validation with expect) that this is non-null. 🤔
replies.author: edalex-ian
